chargeHist.descr: Possess Drug Paraphernalia to Manufacture, Compound, Convert, Produce, or Store Methamphetamine

result.execSummary:
The defendant Bridget M. Zuraski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Amphetamine(<=3g) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(e)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court finds defendant eligible for CIP & SAP if statutorily eligible.

superMiscConds.notes:
$135.00 (from case #08CM178) due by defendant only.
$5,776.94 is joint and several.
Payable out of 25% of inmate funds while incarcerated, balance as a condition of community supervision.
Make a good faith/best effort to obtain or maintain full time employment or part time employment if enrolled in school.

May not vote or serve on a jury until civil rights are restored.
No firearms.
Provide DNA sample & pay surcharge.

No contact with R.S. or S.L.
Maintain absolute sobriety to include no purchase, possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription and taken only as prescribed.
Defendant is not to be in the company of any person who is using, purchasing or possessing illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.  
Defendant is not to possess or consume prescription medications without a valid prescription.  All prescriptions shall be verified by agent.
AODA assessment followed by treatment and aftercare; if any portion takes place within a state penal institution, continuation of accepted aftercare treatment upon release to extended supervision.
